summary.purpose: Aggregates all vehicle icon functions from individual vehicle-type modules, exposes an allIcons lookup map, and provides utility functions for selecting and rendering the correct vehicle icon based on real-time vehicle state.
summary.problem_solved: Removes per-consumer responsibility for mapping vehicle type and ignition/speed state to the correct colour icon, and handles the directional pointer overlay composited with the vehicle icon for map display.

external.name: akeyless-types-commons
external.why_used: Imports the Car and LastLocationCar types used in generateVehicleIconForMenu to type-check vehicle and location data.

internal.why_used: Imports grayCraneIcon and greenCraneIcon for inclusion in the allIcons map.
Imports redCraneIcon and yellowCraneIcon for inclusion in the allIcons map.
Imports the four bus icon functions for inclusion in the allIcons map.
Imports the four car icon functions for inclusion in the allIcons map.
Imports the four jeep icon functions for inclusion in the allIcons map.
Imports the four truck icon functions for inclusion in the allIcons map.
Imports the four scooter icon functions for inclusion in the allIcons map.
Imports the four bicycle icon functions for inclusion in the allIcons map.
Imports the four forklift icon functions for inclusion in the allIcons map.
Imports the four motorcycle icon functions for inclusion in the allIcons map.
Imports the VehicleSvg function type used in generateVehicleIconForMenu to type the icon variable.
Imports calculateBearing to compute vehicle heading angle for the rotating pointer overlay.

symbols.name: allIcons
symbols.description_one_line: Lookup map of all vehicle icon functions organised by vehicle type and colour state (red, yellow, green, gray).

details.what_it_does: A plain JavaScript object keyed by vehicle type strings ('car', 'motorcycle', 'truck', 'bus', 'scooter', 'bicycle', 'forklift', 'crane', 'jeep'). Each key maps to an object with four colour keys (red, yellow, green, gray) whose values are VehicleSvg functions. Used by getVehiclesIcon and generateVehicleIconForMenu to resolve the correct icon function from a vehicle's type and derived colour state.

symbols.name: getVehiclesIcon
symbols.description_one_line: Selects and renders the correct vehicle icon with a direction pointer overlay based on real-time vehicle telemetry data.

params.name: vehicle
params.description: Vehicle telemetry object with fields: icon (vehicle type string), ign (ignition state), spd (speed), prev_lat, prev_lng, lat, lng, car_number.

params.name: isBig
params.description: When true, renders a larger (100px) icon with the newBigIconCar CSS class; when false, renders a smaller (30px) icon.

params.name: sitesData
params.description: Array of site objects, each with a cars array and a color property, used to resolve the site colour for the pointer overlay.

returns.description: A React fragment containing a rotating pointer SVG overlay and the vehicle icon SVG. Returns an empty fragment if vehicle or isBig is undefined.

details.what_it_does: Determines the icon colour state from the vehicle telemetry: gray when ign/spd are undefined, red when ignition is off (ign===0), green when moving (spd!==0), yellow otherwise. Looks up the correct VehicleSvg function from allIcons using vehicle.icon. Computes the compass bearing from the previous to the current position via calculateBearing, and uses it to rotate a pointer arrow SVG. Resolves the site colour from sitesData by finding the site whose cars array contains the vehicle's car_number. Renders the pointer and vehicle icon composited in a React fragment.

error_cases.condition: vehicle is undefined or isBig is undefined

minimal_correct.title: Render a vehicle icon on a map

symbols.name: generateVehicleIconForMenu
symbols.description_one_line: Generates a vehicle icon element sized for menu display based on vehicle configuration and last known location data.

params.name: width
params.description: Width to pass to the VehicleSvg function.

params.name: height
params.description: Height to pass to the VehicleSvg function.

params.name: vehicle
params.description: Vehicle object containing at minimum an icon field for type lookup.

params.name: locationCar
params.description: Last known location/telemetry data for the vehicle; used to derive colour state.

returns.description: The vehicle icon JSX element at the specified dimensions, or the string 'N/A' wrapped in a fragment if the vehicle is falsy.

details.what_it_does: Resolves the icon colour state from locationCar (gray when undefined fields, red when ign===0, green when spd!==0, yellow otherwise). Looks up the VehicleSvg function from allIcons using vehicle.icon, defaulting to 'car'. Calls the function with the provided width and height, passes 'undefined' as siteColor, the CSS class 'menu_vehicle_icon', and the viewBoxFor value 'menu_icon'. Returns a 'N/A' fragment when vehicle is falsy.

error_cases.behavior: Returns a React fragment containing the string 'N/A'.

minimal_correct.title: Render a vehicle icon for the side menu
minimal_correct.code:
import { generateVehicleIconForMenu } from 'akeyless-assets-commons';

const icon = generateVehicleIconForMenu(30, 30, vehicle, lastLocation);
